mecard.util

Class DateComparer

  • java.lang.Object
    • mecard.util.DateComparer

  • public class DateComparer
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class used to help with date conversions. Serveral classes use these methods and there are some things to remember:
    1. Metro server, SIP2, Symphony all use ANSI dates ('yyyyMMdd') by default.
    2. Java uses 'yyyy-mm-dd' if you ask for today's date.
    3. Horizon uses dates in BImport, but the format is set by the user's OS, that is dates are inserted into Horizon based on what the user selected in their Windows desktop.
    Author:
    andrew

    • Method Detail

      • getYearsOld

        public static int getYearsOld(java.lang.String ANSIDate)
                       throws java.text.ParseException
        Returns the absolute difference between date one (d1) and date two (d2) in years.
        Parameters:
        ANSIDate - Always an ANSI date argument.
        Returns:
        a positive integer of the number of years the customer has been alive.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the supplied date is not in ANSI format.

      • getDaysUntilExpiry

        public static int getDaysUntilExpiry(java.lang.String ANSIExpiryDate)
                              throws java.text.ParseException
        Computes the number of whole days until account expiry, that is, the hours left in ANSIToday (if any) are not considered when computing expiry. The reason is dates are passed as pure dates, which by default have a start time of midnight. But when we calculate the number of days milliseconds as of now, so April 10 (midnight) - April 9 (10:15 AM) is less than one day, so days until expiry will report 0.
        Parameters:
        ANSIExpiryDate - date of customer privilege expiry.
        Returns:
        integer of number of dates until expiry. Could be negative.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • ANSIToday

        public static final java.lang.String ANSIToday()
        Returns ANSIToday's date as an ANSI date ('yyyymmdd' String).
        Returns:
        String of 'yyyymmdd'.

      • ANSIToConfigDate

        public static final java.lang.String ANSIToConfigDate(java.lang.String ANSIDate)
                                               throws java.text.ParseException
        Used by clients that need dates formatted for their clients.
        Parameters:
        ANSIDate - 'yyyymmdd'
        Returns:
        The date converted to the format specified in the environment.properties file.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if ANSI date not provided.

      • getFutureDate

        public static java.lang.String getFutureDate(int daysFromNow)
        Given the argument number of days in the future, this method will return the ANSI date of that day.
        Parameters:
        daysFromNow - number of days in the future as an integer minimum 0.
        Returns:
        ANSI date in the future.
